intro: Godetia delicata, commonly known as the delicate godetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to South America and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Godetia delicata is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
